Formale attribuzione di incarichi di ins.content: Fellowship - Università del Piemonte Orientale. Progetto: Analisi economica applicata in economia del farmaco
Assistant Research - Collegio Carlo Alberto di Moncalieri (Torino). Progetto: Ricostruzione delle carriere lavorative.
Post Doc Research Position in Public Economics - Scuola Nazionale dell'Amministrazione, Presidenza del Consigio dei Ministri (Roma). Progetto: Efficienza giudiziaria.

Assistant Research - Scuola Nazionale dell'Amministrazione - Presidenza del Consiglio dei Ministri (Roma). Progetto: Revisione della letteratura sulla stima degli output governativi e misure della produttività.
Professore a contratto in "Scienza delle Finanze" (SECS-P/03) - Scuola di Economia e Management, Università di Torino
Professore a contratto in "Public Economics" (SECS-P/03) - Scuola di Economia e Management, Università di Torino
Professore a contratto in "Economia Industriale" (SECS-P/06) - Scuola di Economia e Management, Università di Torino
Senior Researcher - Istituto di Ricerche Economico Sociali del Piemonte - IRES (Torino). Progetto: Capacità Amministratia degli enti locali
Professore a contratto in "Scienza delle Finanze" (SECS-P/03) - Dipartimento di Studi per l'Economia e l'Impresa, Università del Piemonte Orientale

Organizzazione o partecipazione come rel.content: 15th National Conference of Italian Health Economics Association (AIES) – Moncalieri (Italy). Paper presented: “Pharmaceutical clinical research, an empirical analysis of European market of human experimentation’’.

9th Workshop Italian Society for Industrial Economics and Policy (SIEPI) – Rome (Italy). Paper presented: “Pharmaceutical clinical research, an empirical analysis of European market of human experimentation’’.
International Conference on Market and Happiness – Milan (Italy). Paper presented: “Economic policy, politics and the great illusion of happiness’’.

12th European Workshop on Efficiency and Productivity Analysis (EWEPA) – Verona (Italy). Paper presented: “Pharmaceutical clinical research and efficiency of medical care industry: evidence from the Italian regional system”.
Italian forum of Innovation – Rovigo (Italy). Presentation of the Ph.D. thesis.

7th Annual conference of Italian Society of Law and Economics (SIDE) – Turin (Italy). Papers presented: “Human experimentation and the efficiency of European protection systems of patients’ rights” and “An empirical legal study on the relationship between transaction costs and pharmaceutical clinical research”.
25th Workshop in Law and Economics – Erfurt (Germany). Paper presented: “Pharmaceutical clinical research and regulation: an impact evaluation of health policy”.
26th Workshop in Law and Economics – Erfurt (Germany). Paper presented: “Efficiency of judicial system: evidence from Italian Tax Justice”.
Annual meeting of German Law and Economics Association (GLEA) - Bolzano (Italy). Paper presented: “Courts efficiency and judges productivity: the case study of Italian tax justice”.
First International Workshop on Syncope Risk Stratification in the Emergency Department - Gargnano (Italy). Presented project: “Artificial Neural Networks, Tool for addressing syncope”.
9th Annual conference of Italian Society of Law and Economics (SIDE) – Lugano (Switzerland). Papers presented: “Geography and judicial efficiency”.
12th Workshop Italian Society for Industrial Economics and Policy (SIEPI) – Naples (Italy). Paper presented: “Judicial delay & firms default’’.
27th Workshop in Law and Economics – Erfurt (Germany), 16 – 17 April, 2014. Paper presented: “Judicial delay & firms default”.
ZEW Public Finance Conference: Public Administration and Economic Performance – Mannheim (Germany). Paper presented: “Court’s efficiency and judges’ productivity”.
31st Annual conference of European Association of Law & Economics (EALE) – Aix-en-Provence (France). Paper presented: “Judicial delay and firms default’’.

A long-term approach to Entrepreneurship. The Demography of Firms and Industries in Europe: Past, Present and Future Perspectives, Södertörn University – Stockholm (Sweden). Paper presented: “Judicial efficiency and immigrant entrepreneurship’’.
Young Swiss Economists Meeting 2016 – Zurich (Switzerland). Discussed paper: “Exchange Rate Uncertainty and Firm Investment Plans: Evidence from Swiss Survey Data’’.

21th National Conference of Italian Health Economics Association (AIES) – Bologna (Italy). Paper presented: “Economic impact of sponsored clinical trials in treating patients with Malignant Pleural Mesothelioma’’.

Direzione o partecipazione alle attivit\.content: Project: Syncope Risk Stratification in the Emergency Department. Description: This project is an international collaboration among physicians, economists and engineering, with the aims of increasing the current knowledge on this sensitive topic, with the aim of outlining clear implications for the improvement of the management of medical centres and related public expenditures (i.e. appropriateness of recoveries), as well as the effectiveness of the supplied health services. My role in this collaboration concerns creating a proposal of an innovative model based on Artificial Neural Networks, which is able to stratify the risk of sever outcome after a syncope event with a higher accuracy level, estimating the expected economic impact for the public health care system. Some preliminary results on this topic have already been published in some international peer reviewed journals of medicine (e.g. Annals of Emergency Medicine, Europace and European Heart Journal) and in an international peer reviewed journal of policy (Health Policy).

Project: Judicial efficiency and its economic impact. Description: This project is a national collaboration between the University of Turin and CNR (IRCrES Institute), which is aimed at analyzing the impact of the judicial activity on specific economic variables. Indeed, the judiciary serves the society in many ways and the research group will test how its functioning affects these dimensions. One line of investigation will approach the economic side and I will explore how judicial efficiency affects the economy, broadly speaking. In particular I will test whether entrepreneurship, understood as the ability of individual to start or renew business activities, is affected by the working of the court system. A similar investigation will thus be conducted on the already existing companies, thus determining whether their performance is affected by the functioning of the judiciary. The effects of these relations are important in terms of competition among companies and national economic growth, as well as in terms of well being of the society. Preliminary results on this topic have been already published in international peer reviewed journals (e.g. Journal of Small Business Management, European Journal of Law and Economics, Economic Notes) and on a national level (Italian Journal of Public Economics).

Conseguimento di premi e riconoscimenti.content: Université Franco-Italienne - Research Grant on the project: The market of human experimentation.
First Prize in memory of Fabio Gobbo for the best thesis focusing on industrial economics and policy topics, at the 9th Workshop of Italian Society for Industrial Economics and Policy (SIEPI) – Roma.
Institute for Research in Economic and Fiscal Issues (IREF), France - Research Grant on the project: Efficiency and productivity of tax courts.

Partecipazione al collegio dei docenti o.content: Lecture "Statistics applied to law" at the International Ph.D. program in "Comparative Analysis of Institutions, Economics and Law" - Doctoral School of Law, University of Turin, Italy.
